intro: Lepidaploa setososquamosa, commonly known as the hairy-squamose lepidaploa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that are covered in dense, hairy structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often arranged in umbels. Native to South America, it thrives in moist, temperate environments and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
